name: Fern Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here for the last 4 nights of our honeymoon from New Year's eve 2007. Everything that has been said is true - it's just the most wonderful place, and I'm so glad that it was the last place we stayed on our trip, as it meant that we left on a real high note. From start to finish the family who own Fern Paradise were so incredibly helpful and friendly and genuinely lovely people. The setting is beautiful, and the fact that it's slightly out of town really isn't an issue - it's well worth it. I can't recommend Fern Paradise highly enough, it's the best!
reviews.title: Fantastic - it really is paradise
Yes, it really is deserving of the title of #1.
reviews.text: Really, it is all that and a bag of chips. The place is fantastic, and the owner really makes it a point to help you to have the best experience possible in Chiang Mai. The rooms were quite nice (I got a kick out of the mosquito netting) and it was wonderfully quiet there. The free internet is a big bonus too. The breakfast was pretty good, and despite the fact that we were leaving super early for Phuket they got up to make us something to eat before we left.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was really helpful to have someone to recommend activities there; I HIGHLY recommend doing the Asian Scenic cooking class that the owner has pamphlets for. I can't thank the man enough for his helpfulness even after I left Thailand; I had downloaded some pictures and movies to the computer there to email to people, and when we got back to California and realized that I had left the camera in Bangkok (never did get it back, all 1000+ pictures gone) he went out of his way to help me to get what I had put on there so that we at least had a few memories captured digitally.
reviews.title: Paradise, indeed!

reviews.text: A hint about getting around: there isn't really a cheap way to get to Chiang Mai from the hotel since it's a bit outside of the main area, but you can grab a taxi or tuk-tuk to take you back cheaper than the pre-arranged taxis through the hotel.
reviews.title: FERNTASTIC!!!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Again, I couldn't possibly recommend this place enough; if you're going to be staying in Chiang Mai look here first to see if there are rooms available!
reviews.title: Everything you hear and more

likes.disliked: — location a bit out of city but not a terrible thing

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Why do you think this place is number1 on tripadvisor.com?
reviews.title: customer care given a whole new meaning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This place is a whole new ball game-it isnt a hotel in the conventional sense-- it takes hospitality to a whole new level that i have never encountered previously despite staying at many 5 star hotels-This place is an fusional experience of a man's vision that incorporates an introduction to regional thai history and agriculture/culture in addtion to sharing his passion for the environment and people.This man is the owner DR N -he holds a Phd in architecture and is a practising architect;his intial concept was to set up a museum showing the history of rice barns-cultivation/farming--well thai village life then decided that a museum would not be a viable option and made it into an environment where people could stay.
reviews.title: Definitely a perfect place in Chiang Mai!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The accomodation:The rooms are original rice barns that have been relocated ,restored and kept as original as possible apart from having the luxuries we demand--AC/ensuite bathroom.Infact you will see he is so conscious of the environment when he placed the rice barns he didnt chop down a single tree--you can see branches of trees actually going thru the external structure of some the barns.
reviews.title: Best place we've ever stayed

likes.liked: — Tour of Fern Gardens with Dr. Tantayanusorn

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Environment:the grounds are surrounded by hundreds of ferns that have been individually placed and are maintained on a daily basis.
reviews.title: happy days

likes.liked: — its uniqueness, accommodation style and friendliness

reviews.text: Prior to the fern/rice barn tour (which I must say was one of my highlights of my visit to thailand) I visited the royal botanic garden fern section in chiang mai only to discover that the owners fern collection far exceeds it and indeed the director of the royal botanic garden consults him on ferns...This is a testimony to Dr N passion who is not a botanist by profession but has become a respected expert.He shares his passion with incredible enthusiasm and has shown me how to propogate ferns which i will start soon with the samples he has kindly given.
reviews.title: Amazing! Customer Service is Superb

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you want to stay on the outskirts of the hustle and bustle of Chiang Mai, stay here. The only problem we had was finding a taxi that knew where to go, but that was a minor blip (approx 300baht / 15min from city center). The family at the Fern Paradise greets you in calm and friendly service. Besides being in a little oasis, the service from the family is what made our stay so memorable. The food they prepared is excellent, and again I can't say enough about the service. Rooms are charming and very unique and in excellent condition. We look forward to staying there in the future.
reviews.title: A++ Friendly & Superior Service
Loved this unique place!
reviews.text: We really loved staying at this place! It's rather a private house admist a family's private estate. We cannot say enough about our stay here. The room is an old rice barn and quite a retreat! The grounds are the owner's passion for ferns. The tour of the fern culturing greenhouses was a highlight and unique experience. The owners are more than friendly here--we even received an email from them when we got back! We especially love the home cooked Thai dinner--which was the best meal we had in Thailand! We can highly recommend it to anyone!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only down fall is that this place is pretty far outside of town. It is cheap to get a taxi to town.
reviews.title: A real find! Go there!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Fern Paradise for 3 nights (Jan 22 to 25) for our Honeymoon.
reviews.title: Home away from home.

reviews.text: What an incredible find the Fern Paradise turned out to be. You could not pick a better place to chill out after the polluted madness that is Bangkok. From the moment we saw Ohm waiting for us at the airport with a lwelcome sign, we knew we were in great hands.
reviews.title: Amazing place

likes.disliked: — a pool would have been good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds are something out of a fairy tale....simply enchanted. It truly is a fabulous work of art.....Ohm and his family deserve all the credit in the world for creating such a special place. We certainly felt privileged to spend some time there.
reviews.title: Great Choice in Chiang Mai!

likes.liked: — Great setting and architecturally-appealing rooms, 5 star service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are very clean, well equipped, and offer near 360 degree views. All rooms are elevated with really cool outdoor seating lounges underneath. Our room (barn #2) had an awesome little swing, hammock, and muskoka-esque chairs.
reviews.title: Excellent place to relax and unwind

likes.liked: — No hassle relaxing, great service and helpful owners

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The mini bar in the room is quite a bargain, we ate and drank to our hearts content. As for meals, it really doesn't get better than the home cooked Thai meal that Ohm and his wife serve up. We travelled extensively throughout Thailand, and the food at the Fern Paradise was second to none.
reviews.title: Ferntastic

description: The touch of nature, to live in the old rice barn, to meet the diversity of ferns, to be away from crowded city and stay in a peaceful land which is surrounded by shady trees and variety of ferns.
